docs.lead_paragraph: Some stroke or accident victims lose the ability to produce speech; others, their ability to understand it. But in an extremely small group, the brain injuries produce a shift in pronunciation known as foreign accent syndrome. Researchers at Oxford believe they have zeroed in on the brain region involved in the syndrome, which causes patients' accents to shift suddenly.

headline.main: After a Stroke, a New Accent

docs.abstract: Researchers at Oxford University find region of brain involved in foreign accent syndrome, a rate stroke symptom in which victims shift their pronunciation; drawing (M)
